content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Structure Description
The main target image shows a structure that resembles a simple toy vehicle with the following components:
- Base Layer: Two orange cylindrical blocks (like logs) placed horizontally and parallel to each other, serving as wheels
- Middle Layer: A horizontal yellow rectangular block placed across the two orange cylinders, serving as the body/platform
- Top Layer: A blue cube placed on the right side of the yellow rectangular block

Total number of blocks: 4
Number of layers: 3

## Spatial Relationships
- The two orange cylinders are placed horizontally, parallel to each other on the ground
- The yellow rectangular block is placed horizontally on top of both orange cylinders, connecting them
- The blue cube sits on top of the yellow rectangular block, positioned toward the right side

## Required Blocks from Dictionary
Based on the main target image, I need the following blocks:
1. Two orange horizontal cylinders (identical orientation)
2. One yellow horizontal rectangular block
3. One blue cube

From the block dictionary, I identify these as:
- Blue cube: Block index 1
- Yellow horizontal rectangular block: Block index 7
- Orange horizontal cylinders: Block index 14 (need two of these)

## Assembly Order
Following the logical building sequence from bottom to top:

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 14
   Step2: Move block with index 14
   Step3: Move block with index 7
   Step4: Move block with index 1
}
```

This assembly sequence places the two cylinders first as the base, then adds the rectangular platform, and finally places the blue cube on top to complete the structure.
